item.title: Ronald add a quote by Vincent Willem van Gogh
item.description: "If you hear a voice within you say <i>you cannot paint,</i> then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced." -- Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Peter De Vries
item.description: "I love being a writer. What I can't stand is the paperwork." -- Peter De Vries

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "When the solution is simple, God is answering." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "There are no rules here -- we're trying to accomplish something." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Ilya Prigogine
item.description: "The main character of any living system is openness." -- Ilya Prigogine

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description:
"Quand tu veux construire un bateau, ne commence pas par rassembler du bois, couper des planches et distribuer du travail, mais reveille au sein des hommes le desir de la mer grande et large.
If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people together to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "Religion is a culture of faith; science is a culture of doubt." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Ronald Wopereis
item.description: "Children express what parents repress" -- Ronald Wopereis

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Ronald Wopereis
item.description: "What you want to give most is what you want to receive most, and vice versa." -- Ronald Wopereis

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Mario Andretti
item.description: "If everything seems under control, you're not going fast enough." -- Mario Andretti

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Osho
item.description: "The moment a child is born, the mother is also born. She never existed before. The woman existed, but the mother, never. A mother is something absolutely new." and so in you the child your mother lives on and through your family continues to live... so at this time look after yourself and your family as you would your mother for through you all she will truly never die." -- Osho

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Freedom is what we do with what is done to us." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Bert Hellinger
item.description: "In the beginning, I want to say something about human greatness. Some time ago, I was reading texts of Kungtse. When I read these texts, I understood something about human greatness. What I understood from his writings was: What is greatest in human beings is what makes them equal to everybody else. Everything else that deviates higher or lower from what is common to all human beings makes us less. If we know this, we can develop a deep respect for every human being." -- Bert Hellinger

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Bert Hellinger
item.description:
"But feel what happens in the soul when you imagine children saying to their parents, "What you gave me, first of all, wasn't the right thing, and secondly, it wasn't enough. You still owe me." What do children have from their parents when they feel that way? Nothing. And what do the parents have from their children? Also nothing. Such children cannot separate from their parents. Their accusations and demands tie them to their parents so that, although they are bound to their parents, the children have no parents. They then feel empty, needy and weak.
This is the second Order of Love, that children take what their parents give in addition to life as it comes." -- Bert Hellinger

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Paul Dunn
item.description: "My goal in life is to be the kind of person my dog thinks I am." -- Paul Dunn

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Terry Paulson
item.description: "The difference between a vision and a hallucination is the number of people who can see it." -- Terry Paulson

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Herbert Dingle
item.description: "It is ironical that, in the very field in which Science has claimed superiority to Theology, for example - in the abandoning of dogma and the granting of absolute freedom to criticism - the positions are now reversed. Science will not tolerate criticism of special relativity, while Theology talks freely about the death of God, religionless Christianity, and so on." -- Herbert Dingle

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Stuart Harris
item.description: "If you set out to fail and you succeed, what have you done?" -- Stuart Harris

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Anthony Storr
item.description: "Some split between the inner world and outer world is common to all behaviour, and the need to bridge the gap is the source of creative behaviour." -- Anthony Storr

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Max De Pree
item.description: "The first responsibility of a leader is to define reality." -- Max De Pree

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Charles Allen
item.description: "You know what they say about consultants, don't you? They know all the moves in the Kama Sutra but don't know any women." -- Charles Allen

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Lawrence Lessig
item.description: "Freedom is about stopping the past." -- Lawrence Lessig

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Yogi Berra
item.description: "In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice. But in practice, there is." -- Yogi Berra

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Rudolf Steiner
item.description: "Love starts when we push aside our ego and make room for someone else." -- Rudolf Steiner

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Ronald Wopereis
item.description:
"If you feel frustration then it means you are working on somebody else's problem.
Feeling frustration simply means it is NOT your problem. " -- Ronald Wopereis

item.title: Ronald add a quote by Ronald Wopereis
item.description: "Conflict can only happen if there is something in common." -- Ronald Wopereis
